intro: Microcharis stipulosa, commonly known as the stipulate microcharis, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves with prominent stipules. The plant produces clusters of small, pale purple to white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its roots are known to contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
